00213     -15.93,
00214     6.8,
00215     22.34,

00218     56.6,

00236 static double sensorGetReading(void)
00237 {
00238     if (NODETYPE != COORD)
00239     {
00240         s8 incr;
00241         u8 x;
00242         u16 adVal;
00243         double retval,val;
00244 
00245         if (ADC_ENABLED)
00246             HAL_SAMPLE_ADC();
00247 
00248         switch (SENSOR_TYPE)
00249         {
00250         case SENSOR_NET:
00251             // RSSI
00252             return (double) radioGetSavedRssiValue();
00253         case SENSOR_RANDOM_T:
00254             incr = (s8)radioRandom(8);
00255             *fakeData += (double)incr / 1000.0;
00256             return *fakeData;
00257         case SENSOR_RANDOM_H:
00258             incr = (s8)radioRandom(8);
00259             *fakeData += (double)incr / 5000.0;
00260             return *fakeData;
00261         case SENSOR_THERMIST:
00262             // Wait for ADC reading
00263             HAL_WAIT_ADC();
00264 
00265             adVal = HAL_READ_ADC();
00266 
00267             // look up table value
00268             x = adVal >> 6;
00269             x &= 0x0f;
00270             if (x)
00271             {
00272                 retval = tempTable[x-1];
00273                 // interpolate (val = span)
00274                 val = tempTable[x] - retval;
00275                 val *= adVal & 0x3f;
00276                 val /= 0x40;
00277                 retval += val;
00278             }
00279             else
00280                 retval = 0;
00281 
00282             // Add cal offset
00283             retval += calFactors->b;
00284             return retval;
00285         case SENSOR_TMP275:
00286             retval = (double)(((s16)twiRead()));
00287             retval /= 256;
00288             retval *= 9;
00289             retval /= 5;
00290             retval += 32;
00291             return retval;
00292         case SENSOR_DSK_TEMP:
00293             // On-board AVR sensor
00294             // Read the ADC
00295 /*             HAL_SAMPLE_ADC(); */
00296 /*             HAL_WAIT_ADC(); */
00297             retval = (double)HAL_READ_ADC() * (9/5)/0.931;
00298             HAL_STOP_ADC();
00299 
00300             // Add cal offset
00301             retval += calFactors->b;
00302             return retval;
00303         default:
00304             return 0;
00305         }
00306     }
00307 
00308     // Turn off the ADC so we can go to sleep.
00309     if (ADC_ENABLED)
00310         HAL_STOP_ADC();
00311 }

00327 void sensorInit(void)
00328 {
00329     if (NODETYPE != COORD)
00330     {
00331         // Get frame interval from  EEPROM
00332         getInterval();
00333         if (frameInterval == 0xffff)
00334             frameInterval = 0;
00335 
00336         switch (SENSOR_TYPE)
00337         {
00338         case SENSOR_RANDOM_T:
00339             // Just send faked random data for demo
00340             radioSetTrxState(RX_AACK_ON); // Needed for good random number
00341             *fakeData = 70+ (((s8)radioRandom(8))/100.0);
00342         case SENSOR_RANDOM_H:
00343             // Just send faked random data for demo
00344             radioSetTrxState(RX_AACK_ON); // Needed for good random number
00345             *fakeData = 32 + (((s8)radioRandom(8))/100.0);
00346             break;
00347         case SENSOR_THERMIST:
00348             // Read real ADC data
00349             HAL_INIT_ADC();
00350             // First sample takes longer
00351             HAL_SAMPLE_ADC();
00352 
00353             // Retrieve cal factors from EEPROM
00354             getCalFactors();
00355 
00356             // See if the cal factors from EEPROM are good
00357             if (isnan(calFactors->b))
00358             {
00359                 calFactors->b = 0;
00360             }
00361             break;
00362         case SENSOR_TMP275:
00363             // TMP275, init the TWI interface
00364             twiInit();
00365             break;
00366         case SENSOR_DSK_TEMP:
00367             // On-board AVR temp sensor
00368             HAL_INIT_ADC();
00369             // First sample takes longer
00370             HAL_SAMPLE_ADC();
00371             // Retrieve cal factors from EEPROM
00372             getCalFactors();
00373 
00374             // See if the cal factors from EEPROM are good
00375             if (isnan(calFactors->b))
00376             {
00377                 calFactors->b = 0;
00378             }
00379             break;
00380         default:
00381             break;
00382         }
00383     }
00384 }

00586 static void sensorCalProcess(void)
00587 {
00588     if (NODETYPE == COORD && DEBUG && SERIAL)
00589     {
00590         // Save state of where we're at
00591         static enum {start, read1, read2} progress;
00592         char str[12];
00593 
00594         switch (progress)
00595         {
00596         case start:
00597             // Print out intro, start getting A/D readings
00598             debugMsgStr("\r\nCal node, enter applied reading A [");
00599             debugMsgStr((char *)coordCalInfo->units);
00600             debugMsgStr("]:");
00601             progress++;
00602             busyCal = true;
00603             break;
00604         case read1:
00605             // Don't block unless we have at least one serial char
00606             if (serial_ischar())
00607             {
00608                 // Get reading, send to sensor node
00609                 serial_gets(str,10,true);
00610                 // Send frame to sensor node with cal data
00611                 sensorSendCalPoint(0, str);
00612 
00613                 progress++;
00614 
00615                 // Output stuff for next reading
00616                 if (coordCalInfo->calType == 2)
00617                 {
00618                     debugMsgStr("\r\nCal node, enter applied reading B [");
00619                     debugMsgStr((char *)coordCalInfo->units);
00620                     debugMsgStr("]:");
00621                 }
00622             }
00623             break;
00624         case read2:
00625             // Get reading two, if there is one
00626             if (coordCalInfo->calType == 2)
00627             {
00628                 // Need a second reading
00629                 if (serial_ischar())
00630                 {
00631                     // Get reading, send to sensor node
00632                     serial_gets(str,10,true);
00633                     progress++;  // Default will Start over
00634 
00635                     // Send frame to sensor node with cal data
00636                     sensorSendCalPoint(1, str);
00637                 }
00638             }
00639             else
00640                 // Don't bother with second reading
00641                 progress++;
00642             break;
00643         default:
00644             // Quit, don't call this function again
00645             // End the cal process, reset progress for next time.
00646             busyCal = false;
00647             progress = start;
00648             // Return so that we don't re-call this function
00649             return;
00650         }
00651         // Thank you, come again!
00652         macSetAlarm(50, sensorCalProcess);
00653     }
00654 }
00655 #endif // __AVR__

00740 static void sensorRcvCalCommand(sftCalCommand *calCommand)
00741 {
00742     if (NODETYPE != COORD && CAL)
00743     {
00744         // Received a cal command, save away readings, calc when done
00745         u8 index = calCommand->index;
00746 
00747         // Begin A/D reading
00748         if (ADC_ENABLED)
00749             HAL_SAMPLE_ADC();
00750 
00751         // Save user-entered reading
00752         calData->reading[index] = atof((char*)calCommand->reading);
00753 
00754         // Finish A/D reading
00755         if (ADC_ENABLED)
00756         {
00757             HAL_WAIT_ADC();
00758             calData->ad[index] = HAL_READ_ADC();
00759         }
00760 
00761         // If we have one (single-point) or both readings, do the cal
00762         if (CAL_POINTS == 1)
00763         {
00764             // Wipe out cal before we get a current reading, so that
00765             // old cal doesn't get used by sensorGetReading()
00766             calFactors->b = 0;
00767             // Single-point temperature cal, save the offset
00768             calFactors->b = calData->reading[index] - sensorGetReading();
00769             // Save new cal factors to EEPROM
00770             saveCalFactors();
00771             if (SENSOR_TYPE == SENSOR_RANDOM_T || SENSOR_TYPE == SENSOR_RANDOM_H)
00772                 // just reset the state variable
00773                 *fakeData = calData->reading[index];
00774         }
00775         if (index)
00776         {
00777             // Second of two points, calculate calibration parameters
00778             double m, b;
00779             m = calData->reading[0] - calData->reading[1];
00780             b = (double)calData->ad[0];
00781             b -= (double)calData->ad[1];
00782             m /= b;
00783             b = calData->reading[0];
00784             b -= (m * (double)calData->ad[0]);
00785 
00786             debugMsgStr("\r\nA1=");
00787             debugMsgHex(calData->ad[0]);
00788             debugMsgCrLf();
00789             debugMsgStr("A2=");
00790             debugMsgHex(calData->ad[1]);
00791             debugMsgCrLf();
00792             debugMsgStr("r1=");
00793             debugMsgFlt(calData->reading[0]);
00794             debugMsgCrLf();
00795             debugMsgStr("r2=");
00796             debugMsgFlt(calData->reading[1]);
00797             debugMsgCrLf();
00798 
00799             // Store data in cal factors struct
00800             calFactors->m = m;
00801             calFactors->b = b;
00802             // Save new cal factors to EEPROM
00803             saveCalFactors();
00804         }
00805     }
00806 }

00808 static void sensorSleep(void)
00809 {
00810     /* IPv6LOWPAN Has it's own sleep routines we use... */
00811 #if IPV6LOWPAN
00812     if (NODETYPE == ENDDEVICE)
00813     {
00814         getInterval();
00815     }
00816 
00817 #else
00818     // Only end nodes sleep
00819     if(NODETYPE == ENDDEVICE)
00820     {
00821         // go to sleep, then wakeup and send again
00822         getInterval();  // Just to be sure
00823         u8 sleepTime = frameInterval;
00824         if (!sleepTime)
00825             sleepTime = 1;
00826 
00827         // Don't sleep if we've been woken up.
00828         if (!macConfig.sleeping)
00829             return;
00830 
00831         nodeSleep(sleepTime);
00832         // Ah, that was a good nap, now send a packet and go back to sleep
00833         sendReading();
00834     }
00835 #endif
00836 }

00842 void sendReading(void)
00843 {
00844     if ((NODETYPE != COORD) && (macConfig.associated))
00845     {
00846         // Create a data packet
00847         s8 str[20];
00848 
00849         LED_ON(1);
00850 
00851         // First, start the ADC reading.
00852         if (ADC_ENABLED)
00853             HAL_SAMPLE_ADC();
00854 
00855         sftSensorReading reading = {
00856             .type = READING_FRAME,
00857             .addr = macConfig.shortAddress,
00858             .units = "degF" };
00859 
00860         if (SENSOR_TYPE == SENSOR_RANDOM_H)
00861             strcpy((char *)reading.units, "%RH");
00862 
00863         if (SENSOR_TYPE == SENSOR_NET)
00864             sprintf((char*)reading.units,"%d", radioGetSavedLqiValue());
00865 
00866         // Add the name to the packet
00867         strncpy(reading.name, sensorInfo->name, NAME_LENGTH);
00868 
00869         // Get a sensor reading
00870         double val = sensorGetReading();
00871         sprintf((char *)str,"%f",val);
00872         strncpy((void *)reading.reading, (void *)str, 6);
00873 
00874         // Send it off
00875 #if IPV6LOWPAN
00876         //If we have a report time of zero, don't actually send...
00877         if(frameInterval)
00878         {
00879             //We flag this data as possibly being sent to a remote address too
00880             sixlowpan_sensorPerSend(sizeof(sftSensorReading), (u8*)&reading);
00881         }
00882 #else
00883         macDataRequest(DEFAULT_COORD_ADDR, sizeof(sftSensorReading), (u8*)&reading);
00884 #endif
00885 
00886         sensorSentReading = true;
00887     }
00888 }
00889 
00894 void sensorPacketSendSucceed(void)
00895 {
00896     LED_OFF(1);
00897 
00898     //IPv6LOWPAN Handles this itself
00899 #if IPV6LOWPAN
00900     return;
00901 #endif
00902 
00903     // Only handle this event if we are really waiting for a packet send result.
00904     if (!sensorSentReading)
00905         return;
00906 
00907     sensorSentReading = false;
00908 
00909     // If we have a data time interval, then wait a while and re-send data
00910     if (!frameInterval)
00911         return;
00912 
00913     if (!macConfig.sleeping)
00914         return;
00915 
00916     // Sleep or wait for the interval, then send again
00917     if (RUMSLEEP && NODETYPE == ENDDEVICE)
00918     {
00919         // Wait for the frame to get out, then go to sleep
00920         // Also must wait to receive and process a packet from
00921         // parent.
00922         macSetAlarm(50 + 150*(BAND == BAND900), sensorSleep);
00923     }
00924     else
00925     {
00926         macTimerEnd(sendReadingTimer);
00927 
00928         // no sleep, just wait for the timeout and send again
00929         if (frameInterval <= 650)
00930             // Less than 6.5 seconds
00931             sendReadingTimer = macSetAlarm(frameInterval * 100, sendReading);
00932         else
00933             // One or more seconds
00934             sendReadingTimer = macSetLongAlarm((frameInterval+5)/10, sendReading);
00935     }
00936 }

00941 void sensorPacketSendFailed(void)
00942 {
00943     LED_OFF(1);
00944 
00945     //IPv6LOWPAN Handles this itself
00946 #if IPV6LOWPAN
00947     return;
00948 #endif
00949 
00950     // Only handle this event if we are really waiting for a packet send result.
00951     if (!sensorSentReading)
00952         return;
00953 
00954     sensorSentReading = 0;
00955 
00956     // Wait a bit and try again.
00957     macTimerEnd(sendReadingTimer);
00958     sendReadingTimer = macSetAlarm(RETRY_WAIT_PERIOD, sendReading);
00959 }

00969     // it does, it will start sending data again.

00976 static void sensorSendReading(sftRequestData *req)
00977 {
00978     if (NODETYPE != COORD)
00979     {
00980         // setup sending of frames
00981         frameInterval = req->time;
00982 
00983         // For very low power nodes, don't set interval to < 1sec
00984         if (VLP && frameInterval < 10)
00985             frameInterval = 10;
00986 
00987         saveInterval();
00988 
00989         // Enable sleep mode so we will sleep between sending data frames.
00990         if (frameInterval)
00991         {
00992             macConfig.sleeping = true;
00993             debugMsgStr("\r\nSleeping interval = ");
00994             debugMsgInt(frameInterval);
00995             debugMsgCrLf();
00996         }
00997 
00998         // And start the sending process.
00999         macTimerEnd(sendReadingTimer);
01000         sendReadingTimer = macSetAlarm(10, sendReading);
01001     }
01002 }

01028 void sensorRcvPacket(u8 *frame)
01029 {
01030     if (NODETYPE == COORD)
01031     {
01032         // Sensor frame type is always first byte of frame
01033         switch (((sftRequest*)frame)->type)
01034         {
01035         case READING_FRAME:
01036             // Frame containing a node's sensor reading
01037             sensorRcvReading((sftSensorReading *)frame);
01038             break;
01039         case CAL_INFO_FRAME:
01040             // Frame containing a node's calibration information
01041             sensorRcvCalInfo((sftCalInfo*)frame);
01042             break;
01043         case RAW_DATA_FRAME:
01044             // Frame containing a node's raw data (A/D) readings
01045             sensorRcvRawData((sftRawData*)frame);
01046             break;
01047         default:
01048             break;
01049         }
01050     }
01051     else // Routers and end nodes
01052     {
01053         // Sensor frame type is always first byte of frame
01054         switch (((sftRequest*)frame)->type)
01055         {
01056         case REQ_READING_FRAME:
01057             // Frame containing a node's sensor reading
01058             sensorSendReading((sftRequestData *)frame);
01059             break;
01060         case CAL_REQ_INFO_FRAME:
01061             // Frame containing a node's calibration information
01062             sensorReplyCalInfo((sftRequest*)frame);
01063             break;
01064         case REQ_RAW_DATA_FRAME:
01065             // Request a frame containing a node's raw data (A/D) readings
01066             sensorReplyRawData((sftRequest*)frame);
01067             break;
01068         case CAL_CMD_FRAME:
01069             // Frame sent from coordinator commanding a node to perform a calibration
01070             sensorRcvCalCommand((sftCalCommand*)frame);
01071             break;
01072         case SET_NODE_NAME:
01073             sensorSetNodeNameRcv(((sftSetName *)frame)->name);
01074             break;
01075         default:
01076             break;
01077         }
01078     }
01079 }

01083 void twiInit(void)
01084 {
01085     // Setup the TWI registers to enable the TWI interface
01086     TWBR = 0xff;     // pretty slow
01087     TWCR = (1<<TWINT);
01088 
01089     // write config bits
01090     twiWrite(1, 0x60);
01091 
01092     // write to temp register so that later reads will read temp
01093     twiWrite(0,0);
01094 }
01095 
01096 void twiWrite(u8 addr, u8 data)
01097 {
01098     // write one byte of data to addr
01099     volatile u8 twsr;
01100     u8 count=0;
01101 
01102  twistart1:
01103     if (++count > 10)
01104         goto quit1;
01105 
01106     TWSR = 0;
01107     // first, send a start condition
01108     TWCR = (1<<TWINT)|(1<<TWSTA)|(1<<TWEN);// 0xa4;
01109     // wait for the start to happen
01110     while (!(TWCR & (1 << TWINT)))
01111         ;
01112     // Now check the status
01113     twsr = TW_STATUS;
01114     if (twsr != TW_START && twsr != TW_REP_START)
01115         goto twistart1;
01116     // Send slave address plus W bit:
01117     TWDR = 0x90;
01118     // Clear TWINT flag
01119     TWCR = (1<<TWINT)|(1<<TWEN);
01120     // wait for the transfer to finish
01121     while (!(TWCR & 1 << TWINT))
01122         ;
01123     // Check to see if slave acknowledged the address
01124     twsr = TW_STATUS;
01125     if (twsr == TW_MT_SLA_NACK)
01126         goto twistart1;
01127     if (twsr != TW_MT_SLA_ACK)
01128         goto quit1;
01129     // Send the address (TMP275 pointer register)
01130     TWDR = addr;
01131     // Clear TWINT flag
01132     TWCR = (1<<TWINT)|(1<<TWEN);
01133     // wait for the transfer to finish
01134     while (!(TWCR & 1 << TWINT))
01135         ;
01136     // Check to see if slave acknowledged the transfer
01137     if (TW_STATUS != TW_MT_DATA_ACK)
01138         goto quit1;
01139     // Send the data
01140     TWDR = data;
01141     // Clear TWINT flag
01142     TWCR = (1<<TWINT)|(1<<TWEN);
01143     // wait for the transfer to finish
01144     while (!(TWCR & 1 << TWINT))
01145         ;
01146  quit1:
01147     // Stop the TWI transfer
01148     TWCR = (1<<TWINT)|(1<<TWSTO)|(1<<TWEN);
01149 }
01150 
01151 u16 twiRead(void)
01152 {
01153     union {
01154         u8 bytes[2];
01155         u16 word;
01156     } tempData = { .word = 0 };
01157     volatile u8 twsr;
01158     u8 count=0;
01159 
01160  twistart2:
01161     if (++count > 10)
01162         goto quit2;
01163 
01164     //    TWCR = 0;
01165 
01166     // first, send a start condition
01167     TWCR = (1<<TWINT)|(1<<TWSTA)|(1<<TWEN);
01168     // wait for the start to happen
01169     while (!(TWCR & (1 << TWINT)))
01170         ;
01171 
01172     // Now check the status
01173     twsr = TW_STATUS;
01174     if (twsr != TW_START && twsr != TW_REP_START)
01175         goto twistart2;
01176     // Send slave address plus W bit:
01177     TWDR = 0x91;
01178     // Clear TWINT flag
01179     TWCR = (1<<TWINT)|(1<<TWEN);
01180     // wait for the transfer to finish
01181     while (!(TWCR & 1 << TWINT))
01182         ;
01183 
01184     // Check to see if slave acknowledged the address
01185     twsr = TW_STATUS;
01186     if (twsr == TW_MR_SLA_NACK)
01187         goto twistart2;
01188     if (twsr != TW_MR_SLA_ACK)
01189         goto quit2;
01190 
01191     // Command the slave to send the first byte of data
01192     TWCR = (1<<TWINT)|(1<<TWEN)|(1<<TWEA);
01193     // wait for the transfer to finish
01194     while (!(TWCR & 1 << TWINT))
01195         ;
01196     // Read the data byte
01197     tempData.bytes[1] = TWDR;
01198 
01199     // Command the slave to send the second byte of data
01200     TWCR = (1<<TWINT)|(1<<TWEN);
01201     // Wait to receive data
01202     while (!(TWCR & 1 << TWINT))
01203         ;
01204     // Read the data byte
01205     tempData.bytes[0] = TWDR;
01206 
01207  quit2:
01208     // Stop the TWI transfer
01209     TWCR = (1<<TWINT)|(1<<TWSTO)|(1<<TWEN);
01210 
01211     // Return the data read
01212     return tempData.word;
01213 }
